content.question: The graph of a piecewise linear function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown in the figure. If <math alttext="g of x equals, the integral from 2 to x, of, f of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, what is the value of <math alttext=" g of, open parenthesis, negative 6, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
